DOC.brief_summary: The purpose current prospective study assess effect body weight support treadmill training ( BWSTT ) individual spinal cord injury ( SCI ) . Training intervention aim improving : quality life , walk capability , spasticity , function every day life , bone mass density related hematological factor . The examination consist ( 1 ) neurological classification ASIA standard neurological classification spinal cord injury work sheet , ( 2 ) spasticity evaluation lower limb Modified Ashworth Scale , ( 3 ) walk independence evaluation Walking Index Spinal Cord Injury II ( WISCI II ) , ( 4 ) patient 's quality life perspective World Health Quality Life- BREF ( WHOQOL-BREF ) , ( 5 ) functional status 10-item Modified Barthel Index , ( 6 ) bone mass density ( BMD ) Dual-energy X-ray absorptiometry ( DXA ) scan , ( 7 ) body tissue consistency full body DXA scan , ( 8 ) skeletal system health associate blood factor ( calcitonin , osteocalcin , 25 OH vitamin D , 1,25- ( OH ) 2 vitamin D , ostase parathyroid hormone ) hematological test . The result collect evaluated use statistical software ( i.e . SPSS ) .
DOC.brief_title: Body Weight Supported Treadmill Training Physical Therapy Treatment Spinal Cord Injury Patients
DOC.criteria: SCI ASIA classification B , C D clinical stable unstable cardiac condition epilepsy autonomic dysreflexia significant musculoskeletal problem low extremity SCI Parkinson 's disease
